marketCards.message: Large terminal destroyed by fire; insufficient insurance on building due to Company's delayed move to new location.
War scare promotes mixed activity on Wall Street.
Land rights litigation holds up progress.
National firm leases Company's largest office building.
Company lands ten-year contract with large industrial equipment corporation.
Influx of personnel of new company in nearby town creates a severe housing shortage.
Intensive advertising campaign gains Company three major, long-term contracts.
Company moves to a new excellent location.
United Auto announces new advanced-design auto entry in the mini-car field.
President, Vice-President and Chief Counsel of Growth Corporation of America reach retirement age.
Corporation releases high profit and sales financial report and announces plans to invest an additional $2 million on special research projects next year.
Major coal company announces reduced coal prices to electric power utilities.
Community steadily deteriorates. The management is forced to lower rental rates to attract tenants.
Two founders and major stockholders of the Corporation disagree on policy. One sells out his entire stockholdings.
Urban Renewal Program delayed by indecision of City Planning Commission.
Foreign car rage hits the buying public. Big cars in slow demand.
Surge of profit-taking drops stock market.
Corporation announces new metal forming process which it claims will revolutionize all metal-working industries covered by U.S. and foreign patents.
Experimental nuclear power station proves more economical than anticipated. Three electrical power companies announce plans to build large-scale nuclear power plants.
Large petroleum corporation offers to buy all assets for cash. Offer is well above book value. Directors approve and will submit recommendation to stockholders.
Company's Annual Report shows net earnings off during fourth quarter.
Government suudenly announces it will no longer support ore prices, since it has large stockpiles.
Internal Revenue depletion allowance reduced 50%.
Company prospectors find huge, new high-grade ore deposits.
President hospitalized in sanitorium for an indefinite period.
Buying wave raises the market.
President announces expansion plans to increase productive capacity 30%.
Commission grants permission to construct a new nuclear generating plant of great capacity and efficiency.
General market rise over the last two months.
Strikes halt production in all eight United Auto plants as UAW and Company officially fail to reach agreement on labor contract.
Corporation unexpectedly relinquishes its monopoly on its major product after a lengthy anti-trust suit.
Three-for-one split rumored.
Public Utility Commission rejects Company's request for rate hike.
Competitor invents a new economical automatic transmission.
City Council considers the Company's choicest property for large industrial fair.
